segment.source: description: Use this method in the Windows Store analytics API to get aggregate acquisition data for an application during a given date range and other optional filters.
segment.target: description: Use this method in the Windows Store analytics API to get aggregate acquisition data for an application during a given date range and other optional filters.

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Use this method in the Windows Store analytics API to get aggregate acquisition data for an application during a given date range and other optional filters.
segment.target: Use this method in the Windows Store analytics API to get aggregate acquisition data for an application during a given date range and other optional filters.

segment.source: This method returns the data in JSON format.
segment.target: This method returns the data in JSON format.

segment.source: To use this method, you need to the following:
segment.target: To use this method, you need to the following:

segment.source: Associate the Azure AD application that you will use to call this method with your Dev Center account.
segment.target: Associate the Azure AD application that you will use to call this method with your Dev Center account.

segment.source: Obtain an Azure AD access token for your application.
segment.target: Obtain an Azure AD access token for your application.

segment.source: For more information, see Access analytics data using Windows Store services.
segment.target: For more information, see Access analytics data using Windows Store services.

segment.source: The Azure AD access token in the form Bearer <token>.
segment.target: The Azure AD access token in the form Bearer <token>.

segment.source: The product ID of the app for which you want to retrieve acquisition data.
segment.target: The product ID of the app for which you want to retrieve acquisition data.

segment.source: The product ID is embedded in the app's listing link that is available on the of the Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: The product ID is embedded in the app's listing link that is available on the of the Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: The start date in the date range of acquisition data to retrieve.
segment.target: The start date in the date range of acquisition data to retrieve.

segment.source: The default is the current date.
segment.target: The default is the current date.

segment.source: The end date in the date range of acquisition data to retrieve.
segment.target: The end date in the date range of acquisition data to retrieve.

segment.source: The default is the current date.
segment.target: The default is the current date.

segment.source: The number of rows of data to return in the request.
segment.target: The number of rows of data to return in the request.

segment.source: The maximum value and the default value if not specified is 10000.
segment.target: The maximum value and the default value if not specified is 10000.

segment.source: If there are more rows in the query, the response body includes a next link that you can use to request the next page of data.
segment.target: If there are more rows in the query, the response body includes a next link that you can use to request the next page of data.

segment.source: The number of rows to skip in the query.
segment.target: The number of rows to skip in the query.

segment.source: Use this parameter to page through large data sets.
segment.target: Use this parameter to page through large data sets.

segment.source: For example, top=10000 and skip=0 retrieves the first 10000 rows of data, top=10000 and skip=10000 retrieves the next 10000 rows of data, and so on.
segment.target: For example, top=10000 and skip=0 retrieves the first 10000 rows of data, top=10000 and skip=10000 retrieves the next 10000 rows of data, and so on.

segment.source: One or more statements that filter the rows in the response.
segment.target: One or more statements that filter the rows in the response.

segment.source: For more information, see the section below.
segment.target: For more information, see the section below.

segment.source: Specifies the time range for which to retrieve aggregate data.
segment.target: Specifies the time range for which to retrieve aggregate data.

segment.source: Can be one of the following strings: day, week, or month.
segment.target: Can be one of the following strings: day, week, or month.

segment.source: If unspecified, the default is day.
segment.target: If unspecified, the default is day.

segment.source: A statement that orders the result data values for each acquisition.
segment.target: A statement that orders the result data values for each acquisition.

segment.source: The field parameter can be one of the following strings:
segment.target: The field parameter can be one of the following strings:

segment.source: The order parameter is optional, and can be asc or desc to specify ascending or descending order for each field.
segment.target: The order parameter is optional, and can be asc or desc to specify ascending or descending order for each field.

segment.source: Here is an example orderby string: orderby=date,market
segment.target: Here is an example orderby string: orderby=date,market

segment.source: The filter parameter of the request body contains one or more statements that filter the rows in the response.
segment.target: The filter parameter of the request body contains one or more statements that filter the rows in the response.

segment.source: Each statement contains a field and value that are associated with the eq or ne operators, and statements can be combined usingand or or.
segment.target: Each statement contains a field and value that are associated with the eq or ne operators, and statements can be combined usingand or or.

segment.source: Here are some example filter parameters:
segment.target: Here are some example filter parameters:

segment.source: filter=(market ne 'US') and (gender ne 'Unknown') and (gender ne 'm') and (market ne 'NO') and (ageGroup ne 'greater than 55' or ageGroup ne ‘less than 13’)
segment.target: filter=(market ne 'US') and (gender ne 'Unknown') and (gender ne 'm') and (market ne 'NO') and (ageGroup ne 'greater than 55' or ageGroup ne ‘less than 13’)

segment.source: For a list of the supported fields, see the following table.
segment.target: For a list of the supported fields, see the following table.

segment.source: String values must be surrounded by single quotes in the filter parameter.
segment.target: String values must be surrounded by single quotes in the filter parameter.

segment.source: A string that contains the ISO 3166 country code of the market where the acquisition occurred.
segment.target: A string that contains the ISO 3166 country code of the market where the acquisition occurred.

segment.source: A string that specifies the name of the order for the promotional code that was used to acquire the app (this only applies if the user acquired the app by redeeming a promotional code).
segment.target: A string that specifies the name of the order for the promotional code that was used to acquire the app (this only applies if the user acquired the app by redeeming a promotional code).

segment.source: The following example demonstrates several requests for getting app acquisition data.
segment.target: The following example demonstrates several requests for getting app acquisition data.

segment.source: Replace the applicationId value with the product ID for your app.
segment.target: Replace the applicationId value with the product ID for your app.

segment.source: An array of objects that contain aggregate ratings data.
segment.target: An array of objects that contain aggregate ratings data.

segment.source: For more information about the data in each object, see the acquisition values section below.
segment.target: For more information about the data in each object, see the acquisition values section below.

segment.source: If there are additional pages of data, this string contains a URI that you can use to request the next page of data.
segment.target: If there are additional pages of data, this string contains a URI that you can use to request the next page of data.

segment.source: For example, this value is returned if the top parameter of the request is set to 10000 but there are more than 10000 rows of acquisition data for the query.
segment.target: For example, this value is returned if the top parameter of the request is set to 10000 but there are more than 10000 rows of acquisition data for the query.

segment.source: The total number of rows in the data result for the query.
segment.target: The total number of rows in the data result for the query.

segment.source: Elements in the Value array contain the following values.
segment.target: Elements in the Value array contain the following values.

segment.source: The first date in the date range for the acquisition data.
segment.target: The first date in the date range for the acquisition data.

segment.source: If the request specified a single day, this value is that date.
segment.target: If the request specified a single day, this value is that date.

segment.source: If the request specified a week, month, or other date range, this value is the first date in that date range.
segment.target: If the request specified a week, month, or other date range, this value is the first date in that date range.

segment.source: The product ID of the app for which you are retrieving acquisition data.
segment.target: The product ID of the app for which you are retrieving acquisition data.

segment.source: The display name of the app.
segment.target: The display name of the app.

segment.source: The type of device that completed the acquisition.
segment.target: The type of device that completed the acquisition.

segment.source: For a list of the supported strings, see the filter fields section above.
segment.target: For a list of the supported strings, see the filter fields section above.

segment.source: The version of the Store where the acquisition occurred.
segment.target: The version of the Store where the acquisition occurred.

segment.source: For a list of the supported strings, see the filter fields section above.
segment.target: For a list of the supported strings, see the filter fields section above.

segment.source: The OS version on which the acquisition occurred.
segment.target: The OS version on which the acquisition occurred.

segment.source: For a list of the supported strings, see the filter fields section above.
segment.target: For a list of the supported strings, see the filter fields section above.

segment.source: The ISO 3166 country code of the market where the acquisition occurred.
segment.target: The ISO 3166 country code of the market where the acquisition occurred.

segment.source: The gender of the user who made the acquisition.
segment.target: The gender of the user who made the acquisition.

segment.source: For a list of the supported strings, see the filter fields section above.
segment.target: For a list of the supported strings, see the filter fields section above.

segment.source: The age group of the user who made the acquisition.
segment.target: The age group of the user who made the acquisition.

segment.source: For a list of the supported strings, see the filter fields section above.
segment.target: For a list of the supported strings, see the filter fields section above.

segment.source: The type of acquisition (free, paid, and so on).
segment.target: The type of acquisition (free, paid, and so on).

segment.source: For a list of the supported strings, see the filter fields section above.
segment.target: For a list of the supported strings, see the filter fields section above.

segment.source: The number of acquisitions that occurred during the specified aggregation level.
segment.target: The number of acquisitions that occurred during the specified aggregation level.

segment.source: The following example demonstrates an example JSON response body for this request.
segment.target: The following example demonstrates an example JSON response body for this request.

segment.source: Access analytics data using Windows Store services
segment.target: Access analytics data using Windows Store services
